description: Nagisa is a schoolgirl with schoolgirl tendencies, waking up late, rushing off to school and meeting up with friends upon the way. One morning Nagisa comes across a woman dressed in a strange uniform who seems to stare at her, unnerving Nagisa. Later that day, whilst staring out the window, Nagisa becomes aware of a ball bouncing by itself which flings itself towards her window seat, shattering the glass yet not harming her... Turning back to the front she finds a gaping mouth bristling with teeth inches from her face and no-one else about. She screams and the world returns to normal with her standing and the centre of curiosity of her class... why did she scream?

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Tentacles
tags.description: Features the long appendages most commonly associated with octopuses or squid, often sexually penetrating a character.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/298477416)

Oobari began his career when he joined the animation studio Ashi Production, working on titles like [Tokusou Kihei Dorvack](https://anilist.co/anime/5143/) and [Sei Juushi Bismarck](https://anilist.co/anime/2361/). Soon after, at the age of 19, he got his first major break when he landed the role of mecha designer on [Dancouga: Super Beast Machine God](https://anilist.co/anime/2255/). Not too long after, at the young age of 21, he was given his first directorial role by directing episodes 5 and 6 of the [Bubblegum Crisis](https://anilist.co/anime/1347/) OVA series. 

Oobari mainly likes to work within the sci-fi mecha and fighting genres. His designs are easily recognizable from the voluptuous female forms and well-toned pretty boys he tends to create to appeal to wide audiences. For references, he likes to use images of professional wrestlers and models. He is friends with fellow former animator and current freelance illustrator [Tsukasa Kotoboki](https://anilist.co/staff/97965/).

He wasn't originally interested in animation but was inspired by [Satoshi Urushihara](https://anilist.co/staff/98177/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/298477416)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/298477416)

Oobari began his career when he joined the animation studio Ashi Production, working on titles like [Tokusou Kihei Dorvack](https://anilist.co/anime/5143/) and [Sei Juushi Bismarck](https://anilist.co/anime/2361/). Soon after, at the age of 19, he got his first major break when he landed the role of mecha designer on [Dancouga: Super Beast Machine God](https://anilist.co/anime/2255/). Not too long after, at the young age of 21, he was given his first directorial role by directing episodes 5 and 6 of the [Bubblegum Crisis](https://anilist.co/anime/1347/) OVA series. 

Oobari mainly likes to work within the sci-fi mecha and fighting genres. His designs are easily recognizable from the voluptuous female forms and well-toned pretty boys he tends to create to appeal to wide audiences. For references, he likes to use images of professional wrestlers and models. He is friends with fellow former animator and current freelance illustrator [Tsukasa Kotoboki](https://anilist.co/staff/97965/).

He wasn't originally interested in animation but was inspired by [Satoshi Urushihara](https://anilist.co/staff/98177/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/北爪宏幸)

His representative works include [Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ](https://anilist.co/anime/86/), [Char's Counterattack](https://anilist.co/anime/87/) and [Moldiver](https://anilist.co/anime/571/).

Retired from the anime industry in the early 2000s and has since worked on manga.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/本田保則) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasunori_Honda)

Founder and representative director of Arts Pro.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/新井浩一)

One of the founders of [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/).

**Bruno Méyère** is a French voice actor and director for anime.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- A.J. in "Gutterballs" (French)
- Campbell in "Burn Notice" (French)
- Geek in "Astropia" (French)
- K.C. Guthrie in "Degrassi Next Generation" (French)
- Michelangelo in "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 2012" (French)!~
Originating from Studio Junio, but joined [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/) shortly after.

Junichi Watanabe was an animator, director, scriptwriter and photographic director. He collapsed and died of cerebral apoplexy during a phone call at work on January 22nd, 2007. Note: Pictured in 1988 (26 years old). (Source: AniDB)

Watanabe Chuumei  is a music composer and arranger. He graduated from Meiwa High School and went to University of Tokyo (Toudai) where he majored in Psychology.

He is a well known composer active for 50 years. His work included composition and arrangement for many popular artists, as well as composition work for film and tv drama. Another major source of his work were anime series.

While being mostly known under the name Watanabe Chuumei (ちゅうめい), his first name is actually read as Michiaki.

His son is the film and anime music composer [Watanabe Toshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/110725).

(Source: AniDB)
